title: Breaking behavior change for sync/copy commands in `1.69.0`
body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

None

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I have encountered this problem specifically with `http` remote, but other could be affected too. Given `sync`/`copy` command with specific source filename `1.68.2` used to sync only the single specified file. In `1.69.0` however, it copies entire file's directory instead (or nothing if HTTP server doesn't allow file listing).

Using `git bisect` I have identified the breaking change to introduced by https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/9b4b3033da25ec41aabb35b858a765dd734a5f09 (PR: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/7668).

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.69.0
- os/version: arch 25.0.0 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.10.230-1-MANJARO (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.23.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

Also tested with `1.69.0` and `master` (`2a1e28f5f5683eaba22d67a0e253c95b934f8c41`)

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux Manjaro, 64 bit

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

HTTP

#### Setup

```sh
mkdir rclone-server
echo 111 > rclone-server/file1.txt
echo 222 > rclone-server/file2.md

# Configure the remote
rclone config create http_sync http url=http://localhost:9999

# Run a server (sever version is probably irrelevant)
rclone serve http ./rclone-server --addr 127.0.0.1:9999 -vv
```

#### The command you were trying to run

```
rclone sync http_sync:/file1.txt ./rclone-sync -vv
```

Weirdly enough, when using `--http-url` argument instead of configured HTTP remote, the behavior stays the same even for the newer versions.
```
rclone sync :http:/file1.txt ./rclone-sync --http-url http://localhost:9999 -vv
````

#### Used `bisect-rclone.sh` test script

```sh
rm -rf test-sync || true
rclone sync -vv http_sync:/file1.txt ./test-sync/
test -f test-sync/file1.txt
test ! -f test-sync/file2.md
```
